movie.title: The Express
movie.plot: Based on the incredible true story, The Express follows the inspirational life of college football hero Ernie Davis, the first African-American to win the Heisman Trophy.

movie.title: St. Helens
movie.plot: The movie begins with the volcano's awakening on March 20 and ends with its eruption on May 18, 1980

movie.title: The Eruption of Mount St. Helens!
movie.plot: Originally shown in IMAX theaters, this film presents highly detailed and lavish views of the gorgeous scenery of the Pacific Northwest, both as they appeared before the top 1,300 feet of Mount St. Helens was blown into the sky and during the disaster's dramatic aftermath.

events.title: Ian Curtis commits suicide at 23 years old

movie.title: Control
movie.plot: Control is the biography of Joy Division lead singer Ian Curtis, taking his story from schoolboy days of 1973 to his suicide on the eve of the band's first American tour in 1980.
movie.awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 31 wins & 34 nominations.

movie.title: Shattered Glass
movie.plot: The true story of fraudulent Washington, D.C. journalist Stephen Glass, who rose to meteoric heights as a young writer in his 20s, becoming a staff writer at The New Republic for three years. Looking for a short cut to fame, Glass concocted sources, quotes and even entire stories, but his deception did not go unnoticed forever, and eventually, his world came crumbling down.
movie.awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 11 wins & 27 nominations.

events.title: Edwin Valero is found hanged in his cell

movie.title: El Inca
movie.plot: A tragic love story based in the life of the great latin american boxer Edwin "El Inca" Valero.
